schema:name: Wilmot
regen:landStory: Wilmot is an extraordinary property high in the New England Tablelands at Ebor, New South Wales, Australia. Set on 1,854ha and at approximately 1,200m above sea level, average annual rainfall of 1,200mm, highly fertile volcanic basalt soils, and complimented by a series of pristine spring fed, year-round natural waterways including five waterfalls, it is quite simply a unique environment for growing cattle.

@list: Increased soil organic carbon concentration to 4.5%.
Improved co-benefits significantly with Soil Health ranking as excellent, Ecosystem Health as good, and Animal Welfare as excellent.

regen:landSteward.schema:name: Wilmot Cattle Co.
regen:landSteward.schema:description: Wilmot Cattle Company is an innovative, regenerative, grass-fed beef business.

regen:projectQuote.schema:name: stuart austin
regen:projectQuote.regen:quote: We feel privileged to have the opportunity to manage cattle in a truly holistic and regenerative way on such a remarkable property.

regen:landStewardStory:
Stu & Trish are the management team behind Wilmot Cattle Co and are driven by the exciting ecological opportunities they can foresee for the business. They have a wholehearted belief in regenerative agriculture and the benefits it will bring to the industry globally, as we collectively work to heal what has largely become a degraded landscape. They have a burning desire to succeed in agriculture and are very ambitious in the growth and development plans they have for Wilmot Cattle Co.

While Stu has managed the day to day operations of Wilmot since 2016, and now presides over the portfolio of all three properties in a General Manager capacity, Trish works tirelessly behind the scenes ensuring a high level of rigor around the data collection, management, and analysis of every aspect of the business. They firmly believe that you cannot manage what you do not measure and as such, the integrity of the data is paramount.

In their spare time, they enjoy exploring the natural wonders of Wilmot, including its five waterfalls and large areas of virtually native bushland, with their two kids Harry and Poppy. They all gain great satisfaction from discovering new species of plants and learning about their role in the ecosystem.

regen:projectDeveloper.schema:name: Impact Ag Partners
regen:projectDeveloper.schema:description: Impact Ag Partners is a specialist agricultural asset management firm and advisory service which utilises a variety of pathways and partners to measure and monitise natural capital.

@list.schema:name: Time Controlled Rotational Grazing
@list.schema:description: Since 2013, Wilmot Cattle Co. has implemented time controlled rotational grazing at Wilmot Farm. In order to mirror natural herding behaviors, time controlled rotational grazing optimizes the number of stock in a paddock, matches the grazing period with available pasture, shortens grazing periods in each paddock, and follows these activities by long resting periods to allow the pasture to recover. When managed well, this grazing system increases groundcover, biomass, plant diversity, animal and plant nutrition, soil health, water infiltration and soil organic carbon.

@list.schema:name: Decrease Paddock Size
@list.schema:description: Decreased paddock sizes enable effective grazing at a controllable density. Wilmot Farm has adopted a paddock subdivision program with an average paddock size of 22 hectares.

@list.schema:name: Increase Stock Density
@list.schema:description: Carefully managed, high stock densities lead to evenly grazed pastures, nutrient recycling, increases in pasture health and performance by trampling (or recycling) a higher proportion of biomass, and evenly distributing dung and urine (nutrients).

@list.schema:name: Monitor Pasture Growth
@list.schema:description: Accurate measurement of pasture growth (available feed) determines the density of animals and length of time in a paddock.

@list.schema:name: Manage Grazing Periods
@list.schema:description: To ensure effectively implemented grazing practices and management practices records, Wilmot Farm utilizes the online tool Maia Grazing. Maia Grazing uses climatic data and field observations to determine pasture growth and optimal stocking rates, tracks stock movements, and ensures the stocking rate does not exceed the carrying capacity of each paddock.

regen:landStewardStoryTitle: Stuart Austin & Trisha Cowley have managed Wilmot since 2016
